SUBSECTION.NAME: Example: Arithmetic Operations for Rational Numbers
SUBSECTION.TEXT: Suppose we want to do arithmeticon rational numbers rational number(s)arithmetic operations on rational-number arithmetic arithmetic with rational numbers. We want to be able to add, subtract, multiply, and divide them and to test whether two rational numbers are equal.

Let us begin by assuming that we already have a way of constructing a rational number from a numerator and a denominator. We also assume that, given a rational number, we have a way of extracting (or selecting) its numerator and its denominator. Let us further assume that the constructor and selectors are available as
procedures: functions:
(make-rat n d) make_rat($n$, $d$)
make_rat returns the rational number whose numerator is the integer $n$ and whose denominator is the integer $d$.
(numer x) numer($x$)
numer returns the numerator of the rational number $x$.
(denom x) denom($x$)
denom returns the denominator of the rational number $x$.
